trans-unit.source: Disables the specified job, preventing new tasks from running.
trans-unit.target: Disables the specified job, preventing new tasks from running.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to jobs.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to jobs.

trans-unit.source: Replace {job-id} with the id of the job that you want to update.
trans-unit.target: Replace {job-id} with the id of the job that you want to update.

trans-unit.source: You must specify what to with active tasks that are associated with the job:
trans-unit.target: You must specify what to with active tasks that are associated with the job:

trans-unit.source: Specifies what to do with active tasks associated with the job.
trans-unit.target: Specifies what to do with active tasks associated with the job.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>requeue</languageKeyword> – Terminate running tasks and requeue them.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>requeue</languageKeyword> – Terminate running tasks and requeue them.

trans-unit.source: The tasks will run again when the job is enabled.
trans-unit.target: The tasks will run again when the job is enabled.

trans-unit.source: The tasks will not run again.
trans-unit.target: The tasks will not run again.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>wait</languageKeyword> – Allow currently running tasks to complete.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>wait</languageKeyword> – Allow currently running tasks to complete.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>

trans-unit.source: On a Disable Job request, the Batch Service immediately moves the job to the disabling state.
trans-unit.target: On a Disable Job request, the Batch Service immediately moves the job to the disabling state.

trans-unit.source: Batch then uses the disableTasks parameter to determine what to do with the currently running tasks of the job.
trans-unit.target: Batch then uses the disableTasks parameter to determine what to do with the currently running tasks of the job.

trans-unit.source: The job remains in the disabling state until the disable operation (requeue/terminate/wait) is completed; the job then moves to the disabled state.
trans-unit.target: The job remains in the disabling state until the disable operation (requeue/terminate/wait) is completed; the job then moves to the disabled state.

trans-unit.source: No new tasks are started under the job until it moves back to active state.
trans-unit.target: No new tasks are started under the job until it moves back to active state.

trans-unit.source: If you try to disable a job that is in any state other than active, disabling, or disabled, the request fails and Batch returns status code 409 (Conflict).
trans-unit.target: If you try to disable a job that is in any state other than active, disabling, or disabled, the request fails and Batch returns status code 409 (Conflict).
